channel.title: Around the world Archives - Duff's Suitcase

item.title: How I #Achievemore on my travels
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
I’ve been on the road for over a year now. Exactly 420 days ago I said goodbye to Cape Town and headed off on the biggest trip of my life with my boyfriend, Joe. Fifteen countries and tens of thousands of kilometres later, I feel like we’ve had a lifetime of amazing experiences that have […]

The post How I #Achievemore on my travels appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: A road trip around Iceland
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
I’ve always wanted to visit Iceland, but I always saw it in the same league as Antarctica: the kind of place that I’d maybe get to later in my life, when I have more money. Like Antarctica, it seemed so far away and so expensive – a place you save up to see after you’ve gone […]

The post A road trip around Iceland appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Three months of Central America and Mexico in photos
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Starting out a trip through Central America with six weeks of learning to surf on the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica was a good beginning. From there on it just got better: road tripping around the bumpy roads of Costa Rica in a Suzuki Jimny, exploring Monteverde Cloud Forest, hiking up volcanoes and staying in a […]

The post Three months of Central America and Mexico in photos appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Riding waves: a New Year’s pledge
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
My big pledge this year is to be braver and make myself do the things that scare me most. My first challenge was set to be surfing. I was in Nosara for almost two months, a great surf spot in Costa Rica with a beach break and warm water (read more about how much I […]

The post Riding waves: a New Year’s pledge appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: What I love about Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
On my second visit to Costa Rica, I grew to love this tiny country even more than I did before. I experienced what it’s like to live in a beach community, learned to surf, practised yoga surrounded by jungle, drove around winding roads in a 4×4, hiked through a forest at night to find sleeping […]

The post What I love about Costa Rica appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Finding surf and yoga zen in Nosara
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Nosara is one of those places that you arrive in and on your first day you think “I could live here”. It’s the kind of place that makes people change their flights, cancel other travel plans, or, in many cases – decide to relocate. On the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica’s Nicoya Peninsula, Nosara is a […]

The post Finding surf and yoga zen in Nosara appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.
